net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.validation

Class ValidMarkupValidator

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.validation.AbstractValidator
      • net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.validation.StringValueValidator
        • net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.validation.ValidMarkupValidator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Validator

    public class ValidMarkupValidator
extends StringValueValidator
    Markup validator that uses a MarkupValidatorClient. The string being validated is the markup - not a URL. This class stores the error in the AbstractValidator.setShortMessage(LocalizedText). If you wish to override this, you can AbstractValidator.setShortMessageKey(LocalizedObjectKey).
    Author:
    Russ Tennant (russ@i2rd.com)

      • isValidValue

        protected boolean isValidValue(String html)
        Description copied from class: StringValueValidator
        Check if the value is valid, the isValueRequired property will have already been validated against an empty value. A null or empty string will never be passed to this method.
        Specified by:
        isValidValue in class StringValueValidator
        Parameters:
        html - The value as returned by getComponentValue() .
        Returns:
        true if the component data is valid.

      • setContext

        public void setContext(Object context)
        Set the context.

        This represents the context of the item being validated. Typically this is a property name. The object should be a LocalizedObjectKey, LocalizedText, CharSequence, or object that implements toString.

        Parameters:
        context - optional context.
